# Conclusions

##

![](assets/5-conclusions/the-fig.png){.absolute height="600"}

## Significance

::: {.incremental}
**Inpatient falls prediction**

1. Review existing clinical prediction models for inpatient falls
2. Developed one of the most performant prediction model for falls, using robust methods

**Bridge the gap between prediction modeller and CDSS implementer**

3. Cutpoint selection method to align to value-based care
4. Software to determine when/where prediction models are worthwhile
:::

## Limitations

- No estimate or evaluation of whether proposed model will help patients or resource allocation
- All CDSS rely on availability of good interventions

## Future Research

- What are the estimated patient and resource allocation benefits of using the proposed model?
- Can neural networks model survival outcomes and better handle complex interactions in patient data to perform better than the Cox model?
